span.p: Dr. Franzy Fleck, Superintendent of Burbank School District 111, has a video message for our families and staff.

a.title: Click to read more about: Video Message from Superintendent

div.a: 4/17/20 Update - Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

span.p: Governor Pritzker and the Illinois State Board of Education have extended the period for school closings for the remainder of the school year. This decision has many implications for our students, families and teachers and we will continue to update you as we adjust to this new development. We understand this announcement will bring forth many questions regarding end of year activities. Please be patient as we work through the details. Information will be communicated to families via School Messenger and the district website as soon as it becomes available.

a.title: Click to read more about: 4/17/20 Update - Schools Closed for Remainder of School Year

span.p: Student attendance is being recorded during remote learning. All students must log in to ClassLink each day to be considered present at school. Access ClassLink here.... https://launchpad.classlink.com/bsd111

div.a: Grade Level Choice Board Packets - Week 6

span.p: Beginning the week of April 13, 2020, Burbank School District 111 teachers will be preparing choice boards for all grade levels and specials area classes.

a.title: Click to read more about: Grade Level Choice Board Packets - Week 6

div.a: Free Child Meals Continue During School Shutdown

span.p: Free breakfast and lunch meals (with milk) will be provided toALLCHILDREN 0-18 years of agein our area under a Grab and Go program at all Burbank School District 111 K-6 school buildings. Meals should be requested for only the children living in your own household and are limited to one pick up per day.

a.title: Click to read more about: Free Child Meals Continue During School Shutdown

div.a: Local Resources and Services for Families

span.p: As many businesses and community supports have been forced to close during the Covid-19 pandemic, the District 111 social workers received a list of resources and adapted the list to our community. These resources are confirmed to still be operational. This is not a complete list, simply a few resources that remain open during this crisis. Click here for the local resource list.
The regular meeting of the Board of Education was held on Wednesday, April 22, 2020. Click here for a brief summary.

Our team effort in celebrating who we are on Multicultural Night was a huge success! Our community, families and staff really came together virtually by sharing, tweeting and celebrating all our different heritages and traditions.

a.title: Click to read more about: Virtual Multicultural Event Video

div.a: Statewide Resources and Supports for Families

span.p: The State of Illinois has a number of programs providing resources and supports for families during theCovid-19 Pandemic. Supports and resources cover many areas including: foodsecurity, finance, social services, medical/health condition specific, childcare, and education/learning.

a.title: Click to read more about: Statewide Resources and Supports for Families

span.p: Calling all Burbank School District 111 Artists! Our Art Exhibition was planned for April 29, 2020.....THE SHOW MUST GO ON! We are asking for artwork that represents all the creative things you are doing during the shelter in place situation. Click here for more information on how and when to submit your artwork.Remember to use hashtag #111heARTathome when posting your art on Facebook and Twitter!

Illinois State Board of Education is working with the Illinois Department of Human Services to implement a PandemicEBTprogram that may provide extra funding to families who have children who qualify for free or reduced-priced meals.Some district families circumstances may have changed since the COVID-19 crisis began, so we want to ensure that all our families are accurately accounted for and included.

a.title: Click to read more about: IDHS Pandemic EBT Program

span.p: Students and staff will be using the Microsoft Teams platform for remote learning during the school shutdown. Click the following links for directions on how to use Teams:

div.a: Prairie Trails Library Offers Digital Library Cards

span.p: Prairie Trails Library is offering digital library cards to residents of Burbank and Nottingham Park, which willprovide access to digital materials while the library is closed.Parents/Guardians can sign upeasily on the website atwww.prairietrailslibrary.org. Prairie Trails hasalso unblocked cards with fines and will be extending expiration dates on existing cards during the shutdown.

Starting on March 12, the Census Bureau will mail out census forms to every household in the country. The census, required by our constitution and conducted every 10 years, is a count of every individual living in the United States.

a.title: Click to read more about: Lets Make It Count: Census 2020

span.p: Completely Free Wi-Fi (With No Installation):The FCC's Keep Americans Connected pledge challenges ISPs and mobile carriers to not shut off service for 60 days due to nonpayment, and to open their local Wi-Fi hotspots to free access. A huge number of ISPs have signed on.

a.title: Click to read more about: Free Wi-Fi
